R: @vikkyrk
It's not necessary, it was just syntactic sugar. I don't have any strong opinions about this so I'll just close this PR.

We can't really predict releases with accuracy; it is governed by the community process. But our intention is to have a monthly cadence. Since 2.1.0 was significantly delayed, we already have a month's worth of changes to release in 2.2.0. In other words: very soon.

@XuMingmin I updated this. 

change type of sum in `class VarAgg` to BigDecimal
move` isSamp` field to `Var`
rename VarPop -> Var to make it more generic
move logic to prepareOutput() both for Avg and Var
set MathContext to handle potential exception with BigDecimal divide.
retest this please

@holdenk What do you think about moving this to a branch? My reasoning is:
- Any PR review will be hard, especially for a non-complete transformation. Similarly not-committing will be hard.
- Even after full completion, we may not want to release changes as broad as this to the next available release, and allow some time to bake in a branch.
- A branch will not be affected by changes in the master at random times, we can control when to pull from master.

/cc: @aaltay
